snippet: The Brahmaputra River, a critical laboratory in climate studies, is fast eroding an island in Assam that it has encircled and sustained for ages.
abstract: Majuli Journal; rising waters and intensified seasonal flooding of Brahmaputra River is eroding island of Majuli, India, threatening its 17,000 residents and dozens of monasteries; many environmentalists and scientists are studying island, finding it critical laboratory in studying impact of climate change.

byline.contributor: Hari Kumar and Brian Orland contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Brahmaputra River, a critical laboratory in climate studies, is fast eroding an island in Assam that it has encircled and sustained for ages.

headline.seo: Indian Island Shrinks as Brahmaputra Swells and Sways
headline.main: A Capricious River, an Indian Island’s Lifeline, Now Eats Away at It
headline.print_headline: Capricious River, an Indian Island’s Lifeline, Now Eats Away at It
